dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3904 IH: Crop Insurance for Future Farmers Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Feenstra (for himself and Ms. Craig) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to promote crop insurance support for beginning farmers and ranchers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Crop Insurance for Future Farmers Act.

section.header: Crop insurance support for beginning farmers and ranchers

subsection.header: Definition of beginning farmer or rancher
subsection.text: Section 502(b)(3) of the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 (7 U.S.C. 1502(b)(3)) is amended by striking 5 crop years and inserting 10 crop years.
Section 508(e)(8) of the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 (7 U.S.C. 1508(e)(8)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking Notwithstanding and inserting the following:
by striking is 10 percentage points greater than and inserting is the amount of percentage points specified in subparagraph (B) greater than; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the percentage points specified in this subparagraph are as follows:

clause.text: For each of the first and second reinsurance years that a beginning farmer or rancher participates as a beginning farmer or rancher in the applicable policy or plan of insurance, 15 percentage points.
For the third reinsurance year that a beginning farmer or rancher participates as a beginning farmer or rancher in the applicable policy or plan of insurance, 13 percentage points.
For the fourth reinsurance year that a beginning farmer or rancher participates as a beginning farmer or rancher in the applicable policy or plan of insurance, 11 percentage points.

For each of the fifth through tenth reinsurance years that a beginning farmer or rancher participates as a beginning farmer or rancher in the applicable policy or plan of insurance, 10 percentage points.
